abstract: Why beginning solvers should at least give Saturday puzzles a try, and Damon Gulczynski explains his use of Google as a construction tool.
snippet: Why beginning solvers should at least give Saturday puzzles a try, and Damon Gulczynski explains his use of Google as a construction tool.
lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — As Damon Gulczynski says in his notes below, it helps to have a knowledge of current pop culture — we’ll use “The Simpsons” as an example in the next paragraph — to gain a toehold in a Saturday puzzle. It also helps to know history, sports, horticulture, older pop culture, music, the capitals of Indian states and intriguing yet seemingly out-of-context quotes from books written in 1950.

headline.main: It’s Your Fiction That Interests Me
